intro: Strobilanthes wardii, commonly known as the "Ceylon flame flower," is a herbaceous plant native to the wet tropical regions of Sri Lanka. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fiery orange-red bracts that resemble flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its blooming period occurs during the monsoon season, and it is known for its ornamental value in horticulture. Strobilanthes wardii is also of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological significance in its native habitat.
